thread.title: Traffic builds ahead of Waitangi weekend
thread.title_full: Traffic builds ahead of Waitangi weekend

title: Traffic builds ahead of Waitangi weekend

organizations.name: nzta  the new zealand transport agency
cavendish dr between noel burnside rd & ranfurly rd

text:
Traffic builds ahead of Waitangi weekend Last updated 16:54, February 3 2017 CHRIS SKELTON/FAIRFAX NZ 
Holidaymakers fleeing Auckland for Waitangi weekend are already facing delays. 
Traffic is ramping up as holidaymakers flee the cities for the long weekend. 
State Highway 1, near Puhoi north of Auckland, was blocked on Friday afternoon after a car flipped, leaving a person with moderate injuries. 
The southbound lane was re-opened about 3pm but the New Zealand Transport Agency was still advising travellers to take a different route if possible. NZTA 
The New Zealand Transport Agency's traffic cameras showed congestion building on Auckland's southern motorway, near Greenlane, at 4.30pm. 
"Delay your departure or avoid the area," the agency said in a tweet. 
READ MORE: * Wiri median barrier smash leaves one critically injured 
Holidaymakers making the trek north were asked to be patient as traffic was building before the Johnstone Hills Tunnels. Heading north from Auckland this afternoon? Allow extra time with long queues prior to Johnstone Hills Tunnels after earlier #crash ^TP pic.twitter.com/BRPHVMIRiq â€” NZTA Akld & Nthlnd (@NZTAAkl) February 3, 2017 
In south Auckland, Cavendish Drive was closed after a car collided with the centre median barrier about 2.10pm. 
A person was critically injured and rushed to Middlemore Hospital. Diversions were in place and motorists were asked to avoid the area where possible, a police spokeswoman said. A serious crash has closed Cavendish Dr between Noel Burnside Rd & Ranfurly Rd in Manukau. Please avoid area or follow diversions ^TP pic.twitter.com/pIQin2GbWA
